content:
The Skeptical User: This archetype represents users who have concerns about the trustworthiness or security of the Cita Previa website. They may fear that the website is a scam or that their personal information is at risk, and may need additional reassurance or evidence of its reliability before they are willing to proceed. This archetype is characterized by the quote "The website feels like a scam and not secure at all. I need more trust to be shown to me."

The Overwhelmed User: This archetype represents users who experience feelings of being overwhelmed or lost while interacting with the Cita Previa website. They may feel stressed or confused by the process, and may struggle to find the information they need or navigate through the website. This archetype is characterized by the quotes "The typography is awful and had me feeling a little overwhelmed, even if the information was simple," "I felt lost at one point," "I don't know where the fuck I am, how I am supposed to know which office to go to?", "Can't they simple point what the most suitable location for me?", "There was a button saying confirm, and I thought I was done, suddenly there was more asked from me. It felt like a lot for a form.", "The language not being accessible, and the visual disorder isn't empathic at all with us. Making it harder to navigate," and "I would like to be ensured that they are helping me, some sort of feedback or empathy behind this. A way to reach out for help."

The Frustrated User: This archetype represents users who experience frustration when interacting with the Cita Previa website. They may feel annoyed or annoyed by the process, and may struggle to complete their tasks due to obstacles or delays. This archetype is characterized by the quotes "I didn't know where to find some of the stuff that they were asking for. What is the Equipment Number???", "I couldn't go back, as I needed to verify/change something," and "I rather do it online than in person, but while drinking some coffee, because of a long time, it takes me to find and fill this."
